item.title: Loops in GUI
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

  1. Rewrite: if(x) while(true) if (!x) break -> while(x)
  2. You need to use another thread to continuously grab the mouse information (at least when window is active - use WindowListener for that one). in the thread, to update the text, i’d throttle it with some sort of means as to not hog up CPU time (look into Thread.yield())
  3. To actually update the text, you have one thing right – it needs to be in the UI-safe event-dispatch thread. The functionality you desire can be implemented using a Runnable/Callable and EventQueue.invokeLater()
